reviewText: Everything is good. Nice structure, good for active handling. The only problem I had was the fall-off  of the strap at one end after several months. Fortunately, I brought it to the shoe repair and spent 10 dollars for tight stitches. Now it's restored in the glamour.

I had this same bag about 5 years ago and if finally gave out.  I searched everywhere to buy this specific bag again as it fits perfectly in overheads on most airlines. I travel on more than 100 flights per year and have so for the past 10 years so carry on is very important to me along with quality.  I do agree that this updated version is not made as well as the older version.  Im finding with my other swissgear items once the name Wenger was added to the logo, the quality did go down.  The zippers are not as high quality or as smooth as they use to be and the wheels seem lower quality also.  The bottom pocket getting scuffed and holes in it I did encounter with my first one so I bought a tiny roll up nylon duffle bag and folded into and placed it in that pocket.  It not only added support and kept those scuffs from being as bad, it gives me an additional quick bag that takes up no space at all just in case I need to bring back more than I took with me.  I would continue to buy this bag over and over as long as the quality does not go down any lower than it has.  My bags take a lot wear day to day so I have to wonder about those who say it fell apart quickly how the bag was being treated from the start.  If it were checked luggage for 50+ flights I would agree it would not last as long but also consider the price.  This is an $80 bag that will do you just fine as a carry on bag and last for years.  One should not expect $300 quality at an $80 price.
summary: It not only added support and kept those scuffs from being as bad, it gives me an additional quick bag that ...

reviewText:
I loved it when I bought it - it looks durable and feels durable, but it is not. I used it for two weekend trips and I did not over-stuff the bag. The handle is now bent and won't telescope from dropping it onto the floor. One wheel assembly is tearing away from the bottom and the bottom corner seam has ripped apart and is exposing the contents (happened as checked baggage.)

I generally like their products, and I like the function (deep- easy to pack two stacks of clothes) but this one needs much better construction.

Pros: Great design for pockets etc. Loved it for frequent travel - lots of space and compacts to fit in overhead.
Cons: bottom pocket got holes due to no padding - when sitting upright. Wheels are noisy. Handle not strong enough - mine bent after being hit by trunk lid.
Great idea but needs better construction.

reviewText: I loved them thank you

These boots were surprisingly comfortable, especially since most boots with a thinner heel tend to be uncomfortable after a couple of hours. I could wear them all day and not have much trouble wearing them. By the end of the day, my feet weren't hurting. They fit a little small, so I would order up, but since it's whole sizes, it shouldn't matter. I normally wear a 7 1/2, so I got an 8 and they fit fine. I could have probably ordered a size 9 if I wanted some extra room in the shoe, but an 8 worked for me. I got these to wear at a Renaissance Festival, and I would definitely recommend breaking them in for a few days if you're going to wear them to an event. They are definitely great if you're going for more steampunk style. The tongue sometimes moves around, and the boots squeak a little bit, but it didn't bother me all that much. Overall, I was pleased with these boots!

summary: One size fits all fits well

reviewText:
Ordered on 11/29/2014, Shipped on 12/01/2014, Amazon's estimated time of arrival was between 12/24/2014 to 01/13/2015, received on 12/09/2014. Waited about one and a half weeks, shipped from China to Southern California.

Measurements. It says "one size fits all". Here are the actual detailed measurements (everything was measured flat):
Length (from shoulder to hem): 25 inches
Armpit-to-armpit width: 28 inches
Arm sleeve hem-to-arm sleeve hem (with the cardigan laid flat like a "T") was about 46" in width.

My measurements are: I'm 5' 2" with a 40" bust, 34-35" waist, 17" shoulder width, 11.5" bicep circumference.

My review: It smells mildly plasticky. Nothing what a light wash and Febreeze couldn't fix. The upper arm sleeves are rather tight and very fitted. NOT baggy or long sleeved at all. Like all the other reviews for it, it really is a 3/4 sleeve. If your bicep circumference is over 11"+, don't get it cause it will either be too tight or won't fit. The cardigan is not as over sized or baggy like how it looks in the stock photos. It's also thinner too (more like a light weight sweater or cardigan) not thick or bulky. It really does run small though. Mildly itchy too (in case you have sensitive skin).

According to the label sewn in, it says "acuriru 100%" in Japanese which translates to "acrylic 100%." It's technically made out of synthetic fibers (which may explain its weird chemical/plastic smell and semi-itchiness).  Care instructions are (also translated in Japanese): Machine wash at normal setting in water temperature at 40 degrees celsius or less. Do NOT use chlorine bleach on this garment, Cool iron at 80-120 degrees celsius with a cloth placed between an iron and garment, this garment can be dry cleaned w/o restrictions, hang dry in the shade (I guess that means you shouldn't put in the dryer or it might shrink).

Overall, its a cute cardigan, still wearable (hoping the sleeves will stretch a bit), fairly fast shipping, and the pricing is very cheap!
summary: It's okay, runs very small though.

The fabric is lovely, and the design is well-printed,  but the construction of this piece is less than stellar. It is fully lined with an ivory solid. Neither fabric is breathable, so it feels hot. My main problem with it is that they did not put any interfacing or stiffener in the neckline/color area so if slumps over - doesn't look at all like the photo. Also, they didn't press it and the lining and outer layer ar puffed out from each other and not hanging flat. So...first I have to carefully iron every inch of this (very low heat, I would imagine. Looks as though it would melt on a higher heat). Possibly that will help it to hang better. I have a feeling I will end up having to rip some seams and insert interfacing into the neckline. Hmmm. May end up in my "I'll get to it someday" sewing pile. I should probably re-name this pile to "big waste of money pile".

reviewText: I was really really excited about this product..until I tried it on. Call me crazy but we buy from this brand because we want our clothes nice and fitted. Just got this in today.  Horrible fit...

I stand 5'10", 210 lbs.  I typically purchase clothes in the L / XL range.  I read where several if not most reviewers said that it ran a bit small.  A bit small is the biggest understatement in the history of reviews when it comes to the fit of this jacket.  This thing should be labeled XXS.

Let me put it another way...  If you have a ten year old nephew that weighs in the 70 to 80 pound range, this jacket would fit him tight.  I couldn't even get this thing on.  My shoulders would have ripped through the back is I tried to actually don the garment.

The material is super thin as well.  I understand that it's a windbreaker, but even for a fare weather garment its too thin.

I'm sending it back immediately.

reviewText: Great belt

This belt probably deserves lower than a 5 star, but the use I've gotten out of it has really made me fall in love with this thing.
First of all, this belt is extremely cheap, both monetarily and quality, so handle accordingly. I knew exactly what I was buying and I've handled it like I knew it could break with the slightest wrong touch. What seems unavoidable is the quarter-inch metallic end guard coming detached from the cloth, but the metal is cheap enough for you to pry it off and reattach it.
What really surprised me is how good this belt actually looked; it is extremely stylish. The silver on red is really nice and the belt is the perfect thickness to go with any casual wear. I bought this for a Disney-bounding costume, so realistically it can work in everyday wear as well, just be careful with it.
summary: Low quality, but low cost and really stylish. Just be careful with it and you're golden

reviewText: This is a beautiful pocket watch. So far it keeps perfect time. Brought it for my husband. He loves it.
quick delivery and good quality

Having held this pocket watch side by side with a much more expensive pocket watch, I can tell plenty of differences between the two, but I haven't found a single reason that this is a bad watch.

This watch has a nice weight and feel to it, and I've never been worried about breaking it or thought that it felt cheap. In fact, I feel that this watch can probably endure a fair bit of rough treatment without any issues (though I would have to suggest avoiding throwing it around a room just for kicks :P). It feels nice in your hand to hold, and it's not too big or small. It's very easy to use as well, even if you've never used a pocket watch like this before. Operation is pretty simple - press the "button" on the top to open the front, press it down farther to open the back, turn the notched head on the button to wind the watch, pull it up and turn it to set the time (pressing it back down when done). When winding the watch, I originally thought I wasn't going to be sure when it was fully wound, but it's quite obvious, and as long as you're not horribly sleep deprived or angry while winding the watch, I find it highly unlikely that you'll overwind it. With its mechanical simplicity, you might think that it must only have that, but no - it's also quite nice looking! The internal mechanics look beautiful, the casing looks nice and the engraving/detailing looks to be pretty well done. And on top of all of these other things, I've found that this pocket watch keeps time quite well - 5 days straight and it's still accurate to the second. :)

This watch isn't perfect, to be sure, but any "flaws" I have found aren't really a big deal, and their importance will vary person to person, but here's a few small issues to note: The face of the watch can be a little difficult to read depending on your eyes. My own eyes have a little bit of an issue with smaller details depending on lighting, and the hour hand can be a little difficult to see against the mechanics just behind it. The button for opening the watch can take a little getting used to, as well - the front and back both open with the same button, but the front will open before the back does. It takes a bit of training to learn the proper amount of pressure to apply to open the front and not the back. In the mean time, though, you can always hold the back with your hand while you open the front to avoid also opening the back.

Like I said - there aren't really much in terms of cons or negatives to the watch. :)

So you might be wondering: why would you want to spend 4 times as much on a pocket watch if this one is so good? While I do admit that this is a fantastic watch in general, and not just for the price, you DO see a few benefits from buying a more expensive watch. For example, if you wanted a specific material, such as silver, this obviously doesn't offer you that. More expensive watches will also have certain other features, like a photo insert, or a stand on the back. Other than physical feature differences, while this watch is nice, there are definitely nicer watches out there. This thing looks and feels great, but there's just something nice about that pristine, perfectly clean appearance of a more "jewelry" oriented watch. Bright, clear, shining metal looks nice to me, but obviously that may not be the important thing for everyone. Also, I've noticed that having a nice watch with glowing hands for lower light is quite nice, as the glowing helps a lot for the aforementioned low light, but the added thickness of the hands makes it much easier to see even in full light (for people with eyes like mine, anyway xD).

In the end, you have one question to ask yourself: do you want a pocket watch with solid construction, a nice look to it, accurate time-keeping, and is easy to use all without breaking the bank? If so, this is definitely a good choice. It won't offer the best in pocket watches, but it definitely makes for a good gift or a good pocket watch for those who aren't sure if they really want one.
summary: A Great Pocket Watch In General, Not Just For The Price

Ok to start off it does run small but there is a trick I did and for me worked great I'm not as tiny as the other woman reviewing but for me the sweater fit perfect in the arms. I'm 5'4 and I am 155 pounds size 8,9 and I don't know why but it's perfectly flattering on me and I just the first time I wore it out I received 10+ compliments on it. Now to my trick the day it arrived I lightly wet down the back not so much that it was soaked but enough that it was wet then I have some weighty magnets in our house several so I hung the sweater on the shower rod and placed the magnets on the back for a couple hours for the weight after the sweater dried I put it on and it fits me like the models and I'm no where near their sizes. but the right weight and some water it pulled it right down to where I wanted it without ruining the sweater. I am thrilled with it and will be purchasing several. I suggest if you want it but are afraid of the other reviews of being to short if your not willing to put alittle effort into stretching it  as I did I suggest don't buy, but if your thinking putting effort in would make it worth it then GO for it !!! (just make sure you have something not to heavy not to light) I could live in this sweater it's eye catching and you would be surprised how many compliments people will give over it. reviewText:

I would have rated them a 5 star item for it not my only complain. I've owned my pair for over 2 years now. And have noticed that she matte shading these glasses stand out for is fading away. I used to bare be able to see through the front of the glasses. Now the shading just isn't the same. While the glasses are still in good condition, the sleek matte shading that makes the glasses stand out has faded about 35 to 45%. While still happy with the product, a $250 pair of glasses should lose their signature look.
summary: Great purchase, but with only 1 drawback.

I'm still willing to call it a fluke this time and will probably purchase another pair sometime in the future.

reviewText: I've been wanting a pair of these glasses for quite some time and finally decided to buy them... They are great, I have zero regrets on buying them, don't know why I waited so long... The express delivery was certainly a bonus, thank you.

My second pair of Dillon sunglasses. The quality matches the price: well-designed and well-built, durable. They offer a lens replacement service in case you manage to damage it. In the package, you'll get the glasses, a quality hard case with the logo embossed and a cleaning cloth.

This frame design gives very good protection to your eyes, not letting sunlight in from the sides or from behind. This, together with the lenses, will let your eyes relay even in bright sunlight. People will definitely look and sometimes comment on them, and the matte frame gives the glasses an even "weirder" appearance, in a good sense.

When you check lens polarisation, you will see tension points on the lens (you can find videos about this) -- this is to be expected with sunglasses of this frame design.
I had a pair of these for 8years and have not found any that match them,so decided to purchase a new pair. I am very pleased with them

reviewText:

The coatings did a great job and looked great even as they sank- you have no idea how sad I was.  I'm not young and have had the alternatives- These glasses are unique in both their look and their quality- absolutely the best glasses I have ever owned- for both look and performance.

I got my 2nd pair within 6 hours of losing the first at a beer / growler / motorcycle shop on 30A.  Great place in case you are in that part of FL.  If you aren't in the pan handle just order them now.  I love seeing small guys(companies) like this do great work- they deserve to succeed.  Support them.

summary: so I set off to find out about the best glasses available

reviewText: The glasses themselves are great, no problems at all. They are actually a shinier silver then the picture made them out to be. I'd recommend going by the description rather than the picture. I think I would've gone with a darker color had I known. But can't complain about the quality of the sunglasses.
summary: The glasses themselves are great, no problems at all

reviewText: Absolutely the BEST American-made sunglass. The frosted glass is invisible to the wearer, but provides a cool and stylish look. Solid construction. BUT buyer beware: The sunglasses require care to ensure that the frosted surface does not scratch. Case and cloth included for a reason.

The lenses and clarity are great but I didn't really care for the fitment. The arms didn't really fit around my ears comfortably and the nose pieces need to be adjusted to fit somewhat properly. The lenses also felt loose in the frames where I had to squeeze them back in to make sure they were seated properly. I've had other glasses that cost a little less that fit much better. I was really excited to finally have these sunglasses that I threw away all the paperwork and packing materials before I got a chance to fully wear them. If I kept those I am sure I would have returned them for a different style or refund.
summary: The lenses and clarity are great but I didn't really care for the fitment

reviewText: For the price you are better off buying Smiths or Oakley.  The technology is nice but so disappointed that Dillon Optics doesn't stand behind their product.  Purchased a fantastic pair of glasses less than a year ago. Only worn intermittently and babied the entire time.  The coating has begun to degrade. Admitted that they know the coating can wear off sometimes but that is not covered by warranty.  Better to spend your money with a company that stands behind their products.
summary: This company does not stand behind their product

reviewText:
Great pair of sunglasses, crystal clear optics it is like an HD affect. All glare is gone and a comfortable fit.
Highly recommend these sunglasses.
My husband owns quite a few pairs of Dillon Optics that we have ordered directly from the company. This was our first time ordering them from Amazon. Great quality!
Best sunglasses - ever.  No glare, crystal clear- after I bought 2 pair for myself, bought these for my son.

They SUCKED! THE coating on the inside inside glass came off when I just cleaned them for a week with only warm soapy water and drying with a Microfiber cloth rendering them unwearable. Apparently this is a recurring problem that others have experienced with their glasses. And the thing is... They looked really cool with the matte polarized lens and EVERY WOMAN I passes LOVED THE LOOK! It was like CATS TO CATNIP! Get your act together Dillon!!! I got twice that week because women approached me and asked about those matte lenses!!! But ya can't get women if ypu can't see through them!!!

Decided it was time to buy some new sunglasses. Went to a local store in Scottsdale and these jumpee off the shelf.  I have never seen anything like them.  I am not a sunglasses expert but I have to say these are the best fitting and most unique sunglasses I've ever owned.  I wanted something different than the typical black framed sunglass so I went with the tortoise shell/amber lens.  I found the tortoise shell coloring to be a little more subtle than the black frame/grey lens version but it still has a very cool look.  As far as clarity I have to agree with the other reviewers.  Very clear and "HD".  I'm comparing against my old Dragon glasses, definitely not in the same league.  I highly recommend these and will probably buy again in the future.  I'm only 3 days in to owning these and will update if things change.  In the mean time I cannot wait to see what everyone has to say about these satin lens.

For the price you are better off buying Smiths or Oakley.  The technology is nice but so disappointed that Dillon Optics doesn't stand behind their product.  Purchased a fantastic pair of glasses less than a year ago. Only worn intermittently and babied the entire time.  The coating has begun to degrade. Admitted that they know the coating can wear off sometimes but that is not covered by warranty.  Better to spend your money with a company that stands behind their products.
summary: This company does not stand behind their product

reviewText: Great glasses. I drive a lot for work at Classical Pavers , so I always need good, durable sun glasses. These are comfortable, stop glare, and allow my eyes to focus much better on the road. They are not cheap, but you do get a lot of quality with them. My other sun glasses would always break - so hopefully these are more robust and will last longer. Great!

I just got these Dillon Optics and can say that, yes, you can believe the hype. These are without a doubt the best sunglasses on the market. I have owned Ray Bans, Oakley, Vuarnet, Arnette, Revo, Nike and more. The Dillon Optics glasses put them all to shame. It's like switching from standard definition to HD. I had just one word that I used to describe how I felt when I put these on for the first time - Wow! I let my 73 year old father try them on and he said the same thing.

Yes, they are very expensive, but in this case you certainly do get what you pay for.

I like this shirt and it is super soft and comfy.

Material has a satin silky feel, which is nice, and it doesn't wrinkle during the day.  The colors are nice, but kinda hard to find just the right shoes to go with it.  I usually wear either black or brown, and neither actually match this shirt.  I think it would be best paired with navy blue, but haven't found the right ones yet.

The construction of this shirt is so-so.  It does a weird pulling thing right at the chest if you try and button it up, easily solved by wearing a tank and not buttoning that button.  The threads on the button holes catch and pull each time I unbutton, however, this hasn't caused any actual issues with the shirt.  The pockets stay where they are supposed to be and don't hang down, as I have found with some ladies shirts.

Bottom line, I like this shirt, and for the price I'm glad I have it.  I probably wouldn't have spent any more on it, but would purchase again for same.

The work great.  They fit snug and stay together well in between layers.  They have been keeping my hands warm working in cold weather.

For hikers, these are fantastic.  Despite exposed fingertips and thumbs, nothing gets cold.  I have extremely large hands and they are tight the first few wearings.  However, if you take care removing them until "broken in", they last.  Eventually, the thinsulate does pull away from the wool.  A couple of stitches and back to the trail.

These are very nice for the price. I use them for fly fishing and even when they get wet your hands stay warm - (I was fishing in 0 degree weather)
I have smaller hands so they bunch up a but in the palm but that does not seem to reduce dexterity to much.

however they are quite thick so you might find that you cant grasp things quite as firmly. - lets just say be very careful when you are handling your cellphone...
also the weave seems a but thin at the base of the thumb - so while these are plenty warm, I am not sure how long they will last.

UPDATE: after 2 days of fly fishing, the wool weaving around a few of the fingers is showing signs of fray and the thermal lining has pulled from the stitching holding it in place inside the glove. - Gloves are still very usable and very warm however I do not think these will last for more than a year... down-voted to 4 stars.
summary: These are very nice for the price

It would appear that all the reviews posted here are not for a set of men's and lady's wedding bands, but for either the infinity silver ring (mentioned by name in at least one review) or some other ring with some kind of a stone in it, based on some comments regarding the prong or prongs catching on garments, or stone falling out. Others mentioned how dainty and appropriate the ring was for a young girl, or it (as in one ring, not two) having been selected as a gift by someone's granddaughter.
None that I read said a thing about a pair of solid silver wedding bands, or any descriptions that could even be applied to that style or quantity of rings. Another comment or two mentioned the ring breaking, which I can see happening to a narrow ring, but not the wide bands advertised. Even a photo submitted with a review showed the infinity style ring offered below the listing for this pair of wide silver wedding bands.
summary: Wrong reviews being posted here - not for this set

reviewText: It's not what I expected . I ordered my correct size n everything but it didn't fit how I wanted it to.

I really like this cincherIm a size 16-18 and my waist was about 40 inches on a bad day (bloated) so I ordered the XXXL praying that I would fit it.

I am wearing it right now and in the past I have worn Squeem waist cinchers.  Those are not very comfortable and are kinda long on my short torso and flips up in the lower back area.annoying!  So, anyway I had a few concerns and requirements for this purchase because of the price and if I planned to wear it during workouts and (almost) 24 hours a day!!  It had to be comfortable and it had to be short enough to be able to sit all day.  You think you want a long cincher to cover everything until you get one and then you hate it.  I wear this one right under my bra-line and it ends right below my belly-button.  I have a little pouch that is under it but I hope to see that disappear soon with diet and exercise.

So, it is Thursday and Ive had this cincher for about 4 days now.

The first time I put it on.it was hard to put on and super tight.  I slept in it that night and it was very uncomfortable.

The following morning I wore it to the gym.  After the first few workouts, which were enhanced by the added ab supportthe cincher started to loosen up a bit.  I can tell that I was more annoyed with it than anything.  It was stretching from the heat I guess.

I wear it to work all day and it helps my back pain.  By Wednesday I was on the second row of hooks.  Surprising, right?  I don't think I lost that much in a matter of days but some loss is possible because of my daily enema routine (dont judge me..lol) and diet changes (no processed carbs).  I, personally, think it just stretched out with the heat.  Now that I am on the second row of hooks it feels secure and tight.  My waist looks and feels snatched and I truly enjoy wearing it.

There are no sharp bends in the bones of the cincher, they are very flexible.  It buckles a little at the top and bottom because of my upper back fat and the curve of my lower back but it doesnt hurt and I feel very sexy when I wear this.  Ohh just wanted to ad that when you workout in it there is not much restriction in movement if you wear it in the right spot.

Oh and measure your waist right below your ribcage not the lower waist we measure for weightloss and at the doctor.  That may be what I did wrong and why I am on the 2nd row of hooks already.

Hope this review helps..

reviewText: As a previous customer mentioned "Order based off of the sizing conversion and it's pretty accurate." I wear US size 12, so I ordered that size (XX-Large) and it fits perfectly. It's a cute sweater and I like it alot.

I saw this zip-up hoodie and loved the style, I bought it through Amazon Prime at an amazing price, and it arrived 2 days later.

First, I have to say the material was amazing, the outside was soft sweatshirt/fleecy material and inside was soft too. It was so comfortable. I put it on, and the double sipper thing was a bit surprising. There is a zipper inside that you don't see in the pictures that you have to zip first, it's shorter in length, and I think it's just there because of the cut of the jacket, it helps it lay right, not a biggie, just a surprise. And if you want to wear it unzipped, you can't cause of the double zipper.

Before ordering I read a lot of reviews and everyone says it runs small, which makes since, since the designer is in Asia-someplace. But when I ordered mine it did state the size correlations; S = US Size 2, M  = US Size 4, L = 6-8, XL = 10, 2XL = 12, 3XL = 14, 4XL = 16, 5XL = 18.
I am normally a US size 12 in tops, so I ordered the correlating size 2XL, oh my gosh was it huge! Not just big, maybe I can pull it off big, but huge I look like I look pregnant. Even when I pulled the band down around my thighs, as the model wears it, there was so much extra material that it bunched in the middle and made me look pregnant. When I tried it on for my husband, that is the first thing he said too "you look pregnant". After having three kids I want my sweatshirt to hide my tummy, not make me look bigger.

I love this sweatshirt/hoodie, but I had to return it, luckily I did order it through Prime. I would love to order another one in a smaller size, but the size I want is all out of stock at this moment, hopefully they get more inventory before Fall/Winter.

reviewText: I always give reviews based on what I'm looking for in other reviews that would be helpful to me, so here it goes: I bought a medium based on others because they said it ran very small. So, based on how many people said that, that is exactly what I did. Either I'm very small or it runs true to size. I am 5'2, 106 lbs., 34 A/B and should have gone with the small. Other than size, the quality is fine. The tank underneath was actually the "largest part" of the 2 in 1 set. It was entirely too long. It completely covered my butt and the tops of my thighs. The beige top is exactly as colored in the pictured and fit loose, as it should. So a small or medium could have both worked in the beige top, for me. The model in the picture has much larger breasts than I, so the beige top did not have a "high rise" as shown in the picture and fit closer to my body, but still very loose. Over all, I was satisfied, hopefully after I wash it in hot water and get a smaller tank to go under it, it will look better. But, the oversize top, on top is "in style" now!

reviewText:
Reasons this is not as advertised:

1. The color is all wrong. It's almost white, with just a slight blush of pink to it. Not even close to the baby pink shown in the ad.

2. More trouble with the color: it's inconsistent. Very shoddy dye job.

3. This is advertised as a "midi" skirt, so I expected it to fall somewhere around the knee. Nope. Comes to my ankles, making this more of a maxi skirt. Not what I was promised.

Also...

I have a very, VERY tiny waist. I weigh less than 100 lbs. and this skirt was tight on me. It DID fit (albeit snugly), but I don't think this would work for someone who isn't as abnormally thin as I am.

The material is very sheer. You'd definitely need to wear a slip underneathe. Also, from the looks of it, it will snag, rip, and wrinkle easily.

reviewText: Gorgeous skirt! I ordered this one as well as the rust colored irregular hem skirt and I couldn't be happier! Artka...your products are beautiful and very well made. The quality is great. I'm very impressed with the craftsmanship. Worth every penny. In fact, had this been sold through Anthropologie or somewhere, it would have cost twice what I paid! Also, I'm short and shaped like a potato, and the size large fit great. It's not made for six foot tall woman like most long skirts and dresses, which is pleasing to me. I weigh about 147 pounds, and have a wider waist. Although the skirt has a zipper closure, the fabric has some give to it, a bit of stretch. The other skirt, the rust colored one, has an elastic backing.

reviewText: We gave this unique green octopus "mask" to our grown son who loves goofy-funny things.  He Loves it!  He surprised his friends who were envious that he had acquired something so creative -- and here's a bonus:  it's warm in these cold winter evenings.  It will also come in handy at Halloween!
Got this for my brother, who is a bit of a Cthluhu fan; this appeared very well made, especially for the price. He said he liked it. I'm happy with that.

This is a fantastic purchase. Even though it isn't tightly knit, it stretches and breaths phenomenally. You have easy access to your nose and mouth, and the tentacles are fun and amusing to play with, my friends keep putting it on and whipping the tentacles back and forth. I used it as a costume for Halloween, and it has not only served to protect from the wind, but it is incredibly warm. Furthermore, it is a steal compared to the other hats out there. Even though everybody called me Zoidberg, I eagerly await the cold weather so I have an opportunity to wear this outside. I can even wear my glasses under or on top of the mask, which is a huge plus. My best purchase on Amazon to date, by a long shot. Don't expect to wear it indoors, though, as it gets very hot, and covers your entire head. Great for jogging at night.
summary: Warm, well made, and fun! So much cheaper than the competition, as well.

The thing about this binder is: it's not a good binder.

For one thing, I'm not sure if the seller knows what audience they're trying to attract? "Les Lesbian Tomboy?" Binders are typically worn by people who are transgender, agender, gender neutral, gender fluid (such as myself!), nonbinary in general, so on. Even cosplayers sometimes use chest binders. This was a cheap alternative while I saved up to afford another binder from the official underworks website, but alas, this isn't very good. The main problems I'm encountering would be:
-It's not the right kind of material. Binders need to be able to stretch a bit, so the person wearing it can breathe, so they don't hurt their ribs, and so they don't do any damage whatsoever to their lungs/bodies. This item isn't going to allow this, and is probably going to put the person wearing it at risk. You're only supposed to wear a binder for about eight hours anyway, but honestly, you probably shouldn't even wear this one for three hours. I've been wearing it for maybe thirty minutes, and I've noticed that I can't even take a deep breath.
-It's not very good at binding. In fact, I'm wearing it and my breasts are still popping out. It fits great, but it seems to act more like a tube top, to be honest. And tube tops aren't chest binders. It's tight, but it's not BINDING. I've tried to adjust it, move it around, move my breasts around, but so far, my breasts are still popping out.

I know it's a cheap alternative, but to be honest, this isn't a very good purchase.
Even though it fits well it is an unsafe binder and should not be worn. It isn't healthy for your ribs and can cause major damage.

A nice high quality strap. Well made.
- Edges and strap holes are heat welded and appear well finished
- Width runs true to size...in my case 24mm.
- Stitching is consistent with higher end nylon ZULU straps from other brands.

I've owned many NATOs and ZULUs over the years and this strap rates up there with some of my best ones.
Length is pretty standard for a ZULU. Unless you have really thin wrists, it's not long enough to use over top of a wet suit, e.g. Not dive length.

The rings appear well made, e.g. Solid bronze alloy rings not cheap cast and/or pot metal. They will patina, totally normal and IMO a large part of the reason to choose bronze or copper ringed ZULUs. My rings started almost from the moment I took it out of the
packaging. After a week in the ocean they have taken on a nice brown-ish color.

As with most of my other well made ZULUs, don't expect this strap to feel soft and flexible when you first get it like many lighter weight NATO straps. In fact the opposite, it'll feel a little tough and stiff at first. With use it'll soften, but it'll take some time.

I'll definitely buy again when the time comes.

Pale grey on black, knee high, & (somewhat) skid resistant? What's not to love about an overload of mustaches on comfy (lined) rain boots, especially when they arrive just days before a major ice storm??? They're cute - maybe a bit eccentric, but that's me. They can definitely keep your feet warm - I stood in literal ice water and my toes stayed intact. The calf is a bit snug (mine are a little over 15" - use that to gauge). The toe area has plenty of room (I'm a 7.5 - the 8 wasn't excessively spacey, just enough). Great buy! I've even worn them when there wasn't a speck of water or snow around just because they make me feel original :)

This is a really great company!!!! I wear a US size 7 1/2 and had to return the original boots (too big) to go a size down to 4/6. The company fully refunded my purchase and Amazon fully refunded the international shipping!  All email interactions were also super prompt.  Also I literally get compliments on the boots every time I wear them.  One time a lady yelled from across campus, "Damn gurl you put that outfit on!!! WOOOO!"

Another great dress from Patty! I'm 5'9, 115/120lbs, 34C, and I usually wear size 2/4 or small. This dress was a perfect fit. I ordered the black in size small. I've attached photos of how the dress lays. It comes to just above my knee, and after sitting, bending over, and moving around in general, this dress will not ride up! It's a fitted, ruched dress that accentuates curves and hides imperfections. Even with the built-in padding in the bust, I opted to wear a bra for the extra lift. As other reviewers have stated, the sleeves are attached to the bodice under the bust, not above, but this was not an issue for me. The sleeves stayed up with no problem. You could always add double-side tape or sew a few stitches to the top part of the bodice. Panty lines do not show (yes!), nor does that weird bulge most of us get when wearing pantyhose (you could always do thigh highs, though!). Looks great with heels, and is perfect for date night or cocktail-attire events. I will definitely be buying another in a different color. Buy this dress!

These are basically a good cheap otg pair of polarized sunglasses. I have quite wide frame glasses(5.5") and these fit over them with room to spare.  I've not worn them a lot yet, but so far so good, like others i've worn. Quite dark, which is fine with me. BUT, until i got them i didn't realize the side lens are clear, (untinted), which i have yet to see on any other glasses of this type, so i was not expecting this. If you look at the pictures again with that in mind, you will see what i didn't when i bought these. The problem for me is these side lens let too much light in, especially at certain angles to the sun, and i get light reflecting off the inside of the dark lenses, dramatically reducing my vision at those times (i notice the same effect with most clip-ons). So much so, that currently i have covered these lenses over with black tape, and intend to refit them with some cutout lenses from some old sunglasses, because having them blacked out reduces my peripheral vision. Odd design IMHO. And monkeying around i didn't expect to have to do. They should at least indicate this in the description.

reviewText: NOT leggings! More like footless tights. Still, the quality is nice for what they are. They will be cute under skirts. If you're looking for something more like a legging then don't get these.

I bought the D&K Full Leggings (Regular) in Mint. I ordered these to go under a particular dress, but I was thrown off by the color in the photo. They look more blue-tinted than green in the photo to me, but in person they're much more green-tinted. They look closer to mint in person than in the photo, which will be good for you if you actually want mint tights rather than what they appear as in the photo (at least on my monitor). I'm 5'2" and 117 pounds and they fit well. They haven't sagged at the waist like my other leggings and they don't squish my fat and give me muffin top or anything; they are high-waisted, so that might be why. There is a typical seam down the insides of the legs, which looks fine, but there is a slighter seam going down the outsides of the legs, which I think looks weird. I actually thought it was a really long run when I opened the package, but then I realized it goes all the way up and down on each side, so therefore it's meant to be like that. The worst thing about these leggings is that they're see-through; they're not solid. I can see my tan skin through them just like if I was wearing pantyhose or thin tights. Because they're so thin, they're not forgiving to any bumps or bulges you might have around your knees; I feel like my knees look bumpy compared to how my other leggings make them look. I bought these in Regular, but they are more the way I thought the ones in Thin would be. I would not buy them again.

I am 5'4" and 117lbs. I bought these in mint, lavender, and coral all in "regular" thickness.

I was hoping that I would get a good run for my money since I bought some other fleece lined ones and they were perfect.

But, alas! My luck has run out. When dressing comfortable I always opt for leggings rather than jeans so I feel I know my leggings. Although the colors for mint and lavender are true to their colors on the photo, the coral IS NOT. it's more of a bright orange rather than a pastel salmon color that I think appears in the photos. Still a beautiful color.

Definitely see through.  I have a small, dark tattoo on my hip and you can tell exactly what it is through the tights, so I can't imagine what else will be apparent for the world to see.

Ordered Full Grn Leggings, Thin, 0-6 size. Fit for 13 yr. daughter was SNUG, like very tight tights. She can move in them but she doesn't find them comfy enough to wear around the house. We purchased this as part of a costume in a play so it'll do for that. My daughter is 4'-11" and 100 lbs.. When just handling these, I had to be super careful since my dry winter hands would catch on it constantly; not so with her other leggings, so I compared fiber content. My daughter's other 2 leggings which are comfy are 35% cotton & 65% polyester (super comfy), and 95% cotton & 5% spandex (std. leggings; fine). So, THIS one with 92% nylon and 8% spandex is def. best to be compared to a pair of TIGHTS vs. leggings. As tights, these are very nice, which is why I left such a high rating...I have seen the trend in leggings to be this tight so it's personal preference. BTW, color was very close to the photo online...it's a tad more yellowish in the photo but it's very close to the actual color that is slightly darker but very intense green. IT was not see-through like pantyhose; very solid...like tights.

reviewText: Excellent

I ADORE my Artka sweatshirt. Its definitely on the pricey end, but the quality materials and sewing make it worth it.
I love how it looks very unique and I constantly receive compliments on it.
The hood is detachable which is a nice feature since it tends to get in the way when I wear my backpack and I'm not actually using the hood.

It can be a struggle to take off in public if you're wearing a shirt underneath that you don't want to ride up/completely come off with the sweatshirt

The pockets are roomy

Wearing a scarf is recommended to expand the collar to its full shape, but it still looks good without a scarf underneath.

I have a 30" bust and I'm petite so the small fit well. I'm not sure if this would work well for anyone with a bust larger than 36" based on the measurements given in the product description

My only (minor) complaint is that the elastic in the waistband can be a bit frustrating at times since the bottom intentionally sort of folds under

Overall I would definitely recommend this to anyone looking for something unique and willing to shell out $90 for a beautiful sweatshirt

reviewText:

reviewText:
Only one thing prevents this from being the best hoodie ever. If you're like me and you often put your hands in your jacket pockets, like, ALL THE TIME, you'll find that one hand gets left out in the cold with this one. The vertical zip pocket is fine, but that little horizontal-ish-kinda-diagonal one will require you to cram your fist into uncomfortably tight quarters.

I wear it anyway, but it often reminds me of its one stylish but nonfunctional flaw. If you happen to have a super sweet pair of gloves where you somehow managed to misplace one of the two, this may be the perfect jacket for you.
Classy and hip, it looks great.

The fabric of this jacket is like one of those cheap sweatshirts you bought and then could never wear because it gets fuzzies all over whatever shirt you wear under it.  I have washed the jacket multiple times inside out and still get lint and fuzz all over whatever shirt I wear under it.  So I pretty much never wear this jacket and am super bummed about it.  I will say I really like Patty Boutique and have loved multiple shirts from them but their jackets and skirts are eh...

As always, the shipping was quick, the packaging was elegant, and a note from Patty was included.  She takes great care of her customers!  I ordered this jacket expecting something a little more fancy, but it is more like a heavy hoodie with a Biker Jacket look.  It took me a few days to get use to it, but I decided to keep it because it is a great fit.  I love the asymmetric zip because it feels like you are wrapped up in a blanket.  I'm tall (5'11" - ordered a large), so I really appreciate the long sleeves and torso of the jacket, the hood is actually big enough to cover your head comfortably.  It isn't really heavy, but I have a lightweight vest that looks good under it for those colder days -- the arms are tight, so I don't think I could comfortably wear a bulky long-sleeve under it.  My workplace is cold, so I usually wear my jacket all day, and since the material is mostly cotton it doesn't restrict movement.  The only thing I don't like is the left-hand zipper is small, but the pocket is large, so it is difficult to get my phone in and out of that pocket.  You definitely  can't use it for a hand warmer!  Also, since the pockets all have a zipper, they are a little rough around the edges, but that's to be expected with that style.
Yet another item from ParryBoutik. The sweater is super warm. You don't even need a jacket when you have it on. Absolutely perfect!
summary: The sweater is super warm. You don't even need a jacket when ...

reviewText: This jacket looks really good on and is very warm. It's good material and well constructed. The one thing I don't like are the ludicrous pockets. There is only one pocket for your hand with a metal zipper on it that scrapes the flesh off the back of your hand when you reach in. There's one smaller horizontal pocket on the other side that holds about two quarters and the breast pocket is fake pocket, as in not a pocket at all, just a random zipper that opens to no where. So if you two hands and need to keep them warm, don't buy this jacket.

reviewText: This belt is not an "exact scale replica" I ordered one from the source and it is not the belt shown on WWE tv! It's nice and all but the little things, turn into big things when you really look at it.  The stone count on the border of the main plate is 10 on this belt, The real belt 11, The underscore on the real one has bigger Stones and more detail, the one you get is small stones that look really out of place. The so called "tooling" behind the main plate is just a piece of "leather" no tooling like the real belt on t.v.  For the price you pay for a "EXACT SCALE REPLICA" it shouldn't have these issues.  By the way this is the third version of this belt. The second version was almost identical to the one on T.V.  I don't don't know what they have done but it really sucks that they charge this much money for something that is so inferior to the last version they sold.
summary: They should be sued for false advertisement!!!!!

I was a bit reluctant to buy this bag. I wanted a well designed gym bag. I was tired with struggling with the zipper on my cheap bag. I really liked most of the designs I saw made by this company, but there were no reviews for any of their bags, this review is the first. So I was taking a chance.  Evidentially I bought the last one Amazon offered through Prime, I didn't have to pay for shipping and I had the "free returns" option, so the risk was minimal.

I opened the box expecting to be a little disappointed - but was I surprised! This bag is perfect. Perfect design, materials, stitching, lining - everything! And there were a few nice surprises. I thought there was a possibility that, from the pictures showing a side zippered panel, that there might be a shoe compartment, and I was right. There are three inside pockets, two open with leather piping on the top for cell phone and easy access, and a nice zippered pocket with a very high quality leather front. All of the stitching on this bag, both inside and out is perfect.

The side panel, shown in the photographs with a sort of sideways "S" shape is one large pocket, deeper on one end and shallower on the other. There is a nice contrasting brown canvas panel that mirrors the exterior under the pocket - an unnecessary detail that reflects the quality of the bag. The leather strip that holds the two handles together snaps together easily and has a nice feel to the grip. The high quality zippers are a little stiff, but I expect they will loosen up with use.

I searched through this bag to see if there is one negative thing I can say about it, but I can't find anything wrong with it.

The bag is extremely handsome and well made. Don't hesitate in purchasing one.
Beautiful craftsmanship. Newstone never disappoints on any product I have purchased. I will be buying from them again

Amazing right!? I love the prayer beads and the level of customer service exhibited by NEWSTONE is above and beyond anything I've experienced...thank-you so much!

This pendant is exquisite. The cameo itself is dainty, yet incredibly detailed. The simple open-back setting is the perfect complement; understated and sophisticated. The sterling silver chain accompanying the pendant is fine, but surprisingly strong - completing the entire beautiful picture.

The cameo and chain are presented in a lovely box, complete with ribbon and bow. They were placed in separate tiny plastic bags, which protected each of them and prevented the chain from becoming tangled.

Sabrina Silver were outstanding to deal with. I initially ordered this necklace, and then cancelled it a couple of hours later. This was mainly due to the fact that I am a terrible procrastinator and over-thinker. The fact that there were no buyer reviews, was a big factor in my decision-making. I live in Australia, and the subsequent distance/time/cost factor if I wasn't happy with my purchase, came into play also. Sabrina Silver were gracious enough to cancel my order without question. Obviously, I changed my mind a few days later. I couldn't get this beautiful angel out of my head! I had looked at many others in all sorts of settings and finishes, but this is the one that stayed with me. I re-ordered her, and felt a little (read: a lot!) uncomfortable doing so. I kept waiting for a "Are you really sure this time, Skye?" email - but of course it never came. Instead, I received notification that she had been put in the post and was on her way. My beautiful necklace arrived today - a week later - and I am thrilled. My original hesitation was unfounded.

I hope that this review may serve as a note of confidence for anyone who has wanted to purchase the pendant, but hesitated due to the lack of feedback. You will not regret your choice. She is my every day and forever necklace. She is so very special. Thank you, Sabrina Silver, for my beautiful necklace and your kind, professional service.

Ok, this is the ultimate body/con dress, it shows everything! I got it during the holidays, tried it on and realized I had to go on my new year's regimen for about a month before I was ready to consider wearing it as a flat tummy is a must for this dress.  The work paid off, I wore this dress and loved it...it is simple and elegant and gives you a long lean line if you have dealt with your bulges.  It fits well and is made of medium weight bodycon fabric that will hold you together, while still hugging your curves, if you get my drift?!!  It is of course junior sized; US size 8/10 which I bought is probably equivalent to a medium range junior size 7 or 9 found in US stores.  I am 5'3" and the dress hits me mid calf, a good length for wearing to less raunchy outings when one wants to be stylish, such as nice dinners, broadway show, or performances at the local opera house or concert hall, hip w/o that video hoe vibe!  I wore with a necklace that fits close to the neck, python booties and a black fur chubby.  Got lots of looks, I think were admiring since no one laughed...glad I was able to pull this off!  For a fashionista who likes to keep her costs down, this dress is a great buy for the style.
summary: Really had to do the work to wear this!

Reading the other reviews I knew these jeans would be really small so I measured my waist and hips and looked at the sizing chart. Unfortunately the sizing chart showed even numbered sizes and the jeans were selling in odd numbered sizes. So it said I would measure at a 10 and I ended up ordering an 11 thinking the 95%cotton would shrink. My hips measure at 39 and my waist at 30, I am 5'3 and I normally wear a size 4 jean. I have a bit of room in my waist at a size 11 and they are long enough to fold over a couple of inches at my ankles. They did not shrink hardly at all. Over all I am happy with them but I think I would try for a size 9 if I were to order again. As for the color, it is spot on!

Update: so a few months later I had lost a couple of pounds and I needed these for a photo shoot and the 11 ended up being way too big. I went ahead and ordered a size 7 which fit great. After wearing I noticed they stretch out a lot. However, be aware that although the listing (for me) said *free returns*, the company will NOT honor that. I went back and forth with them and they gave me some BS answer about why they wouldnt even though my size and color did say free returns. Needless to say they are not trustworthy if you run into a problem. I will not ever order from them again. Buyer Beware.
summary: Measure and order to the sizing chart, but Buyer Beware this company is SHADY

I will say the color is beautiful with the white version of the wig I got. But the hair is so thin that you could see the yellow wig mesh where the long locks separated over my shoulders. Not to mention...I got about 5 mins in the convention before the wig went naptastic on me. I ended up spending 2 1/2 hours cutting and brushing a water/lotion concoction on the wig in order to get one more day out of it (2 DAYS).

It did however arrive on time and was incredibly easy on my wallet at $12. But do what I should have done at first if you get this wig. take a wig brush and brush starting midway of the wigs length to the tips with 1 part lotion and 3 parts water. It was manageable with my fingers for a few hours with this added the second day :)

reviewText: Pretty

When you read "tubular" in the description, think hollow. Unfortunately, the fact that they are hollow and that the walls are very thin (0.2 mm or 0.008 in as measured with my caliper) means that they bend very easily and will eventually break. reviewText: I ordered these socks from the internet site after my grandson, Matthew, told me that the young people these days are all looking at these cat pictures. I originally purchased these for my youngest granddaughter because she's always wearing the little socks that you can't see when you're wearing shoes. As soon as I saw them in person I fell in LOVE! It looks just like my Snowball, and I knew I had to keep them. she loves to play with them, and at my old age I can't be wearing silly things like that. I went to the bingo on Thursday with my friend Patty and her friend has a grandson who goes to College in Maine, and he was just fishing with his friends on Chesuncook Lake and it sounded wonderful! Paul and I are taking a trip up there next month to stay at a beautiful hotel with an exhibit of old, Native American quilts that I am just DYING to see. My darling Snowball loves to play with these socks, and the grandkids love seeing her with them. I give this product 4 out of 5 stars because my husband Paul is allergic to cat fur and we have to give Snowball to my daughter who lives in the city. I can't wait to go up to Maine and see the lakes!

If/when they rip at the waistband or elsewhere I might come back to modify the rating based on how long until that happens.  I try to grab them by some of the material and not just the band when pulling them up.  I hate it when underwear rip at the band when the rest of them is perfectly fine.

These bunch up a bit in the upper thigh area so I find myself rearranging them often. Also, I just noticed a small hole in the crotch area after only wearing the pair once and hand washing it after with a line dry (not machine dried or washed). For a hole to appear so soon after light wear and delicate washing/drying is very concerning. I don't think these are going to last very long....

reviewText: I've already raved over these tags! They look like real leather so that's why I keep buying them!
I've been trying to find brown luggage tags for a long time, now I finally found it and at a good price too. I love the sayings on the tags as well. I ended up buying tow.

This review has to do only with the verse inscribed on the leather. It's a great verse, but most people don't realize that it isn't a promise for all people/Christian/Jews for all time. The prophecy and promises in Jeremiah 29 were addressed to a specific group of Jews who were Babylonian exiles carried into captivity with their King Jeconiah in the 6th Century. It's still a nice thought if you want this on your luggage tag. But no one knows what God's plans may be for someone from this century. I would love to see a more relevant verse on this luggage tag.

I needed a Victorian-inspired blouse for a particular costume. This Lolita Blouse was exactly what I needed. Seller was very courteous and gracious and offered to custom-make my order. I gave them my measurements: chest, waist, hip, etc. and they did the rest. The item fits PERFECTLY and I'm not exaggerating. I have a very disproportionate body. Large chest, very short torso, and waist and hips are almost the same measurement. There is always gaping in the chest or it is too tight in some areas. One feature that I love about the blouse is the lace up detail in the back. It can be tightened or loosened for a fitted look. There is a lot of pin-tucking that gives you the hour glass shape while hiding any problem areas. I have a broad shoulder that tends to be wider but this fit perfectly like a dream. Sleeves were the exact length as well. The only con if a con at all is that the lace is a slightly different color than the white cotton that is used for the blouse. It's very subtle and likely not detected or commented by others but nonetheless it remains the facts. I'd say it's an off-white or eggshell color. I would still highly recommend this to anyone looking for something that fits, flatters, and wants something high quality and custom made.

reviewText: I like this travel bag.  Holds everything I need and lies flat in my suitcase so it doesn't seem to take up as much room.

Update: After I posted the above review, they sent me a new bag. I waited until I'd used it to write an updated review. I just took it on a two week trip to Spain and to Cape Cod for a week and the handle has held up. Ended up the x-small was too small for me so this time I thought I'd return it.  Contacted the seller per the clear instructions on amazon and received an email back within minutes.  Seller suggested I keep the shirt while they went ahead and refunded the cost, saving me the cost to ship it back.  That amazed me, the extent of that customer service, just outstanding and courteous.  In the meantime, I should add that both times I ordered the shirt, it arrived at my house within days, yes, that quickly.  Really love the shirt and the medium fits me in a boyfriend-shirt way, kind of fun.  Amazing that the price is so low for a well-made shirt.  Thank you for the excellent product and service!

Original Review:
I purchased this a while back but haven't brought myself to wear it because the first time I tried it on (I bought the gray one), I felt like I was wearing a gas station attendant costume. It was too masculine for me--I think it's because the sleeves are too wide or long for me, or the length from the collar to the shoulder is too long (also because the material is stiff). [measurements below]
I just tried it on again and it's not so bad, but there is still something "rugged" about it, which is not the look I'm going for. I may try removing the tiny buttons on the collar to see if it helps. Maybe a smaller size, for a more fitted look would have been better for me. I regret not asking if the returns were free--I'm guessing I've waited too long.

The item looks like the photo and the fabric is thin but not transparent. There's a 1.5" pleat on the back, between the shoulders with a horizontal loop.
On the MEDIUM, the width of the sleeve is 7" at the opening and 10" from armpit to shoulder. The length from the shoulder seam to the top edge of the sleeve is 7.5" and the distance from the collar seam to the shoulder is 6.5." The "bust," from armpit to armpit is about 23" wide, it's 20.5" at the waist and the length of the shirt is about 29."

On the SMALL, the width of the sleeve is 7" at the opening and 9" from armpit to shoulder. The length from the shoulder seam to the top edge of the sleeve is 7.25" and the distance from the collar seam to the shoulder is 6." The "bust," from armpit to armpit is about 21" wide, it's 19" at the waist and the length of the shirt is about 28."
summary: Boxier than expected, but seems of good quality

reviewText: Exactly as it looks on the picture

Hi Ladies,
I bought this in SMALL (the Olive) Cardigan. Let me mention also that I'm 5'71/2  My weight is 160-168. my waist is large
bust:36-37 C.  This cardigan fit perfectly!. I would say also it came to my knees like in the photo ,the sleeves were about 1-2 inches
above my wrist, so these sleeves are long enough. They have batwing arms if you look at the photo,so you will definitely have room
to move. The reason I'm giving all this info is ,like you, I really wanted this, however I was not sure what size to get. I didn't want to swim in this,
And I didn't want to use this as one of those snuggie-things , I wanted to wear this out, and look good wearing it !.

PLEASE, if you have measurements similar to mine, don't be afraid to buy the small. I got the color AND THE FIT, and so can you(if the color is)
still AVAILABLE. so don't fear or hesitate, this isn't so much a cardigan, it's 78% polyester however it's good for early fall. it's in the 70's here in Ohio
at this time and sunny, so I could wear this today with a short sleeve blouse if I wanted. Don't expect sweater like material THIS is not THAT.
this is good for work(offices) or a nice cover up over a top for dinner out. Get a nice elastic belt or any WIDE belt and/or a nice pin or broach and you will look stylish!!. it will work with jeans or leggings as picture on model, or a longer skirt or dress for that matter. IF, THIS REVIEW has helped click YES below. THANK YOU. All reviewers appreciate feedback.
summary: GO FOR WHAT YOU WANT, LADIES!.

reviewText: Too puffy, too large. But was very warm

This is the best winter coat I have ever owned. The first time I put it on, I received compliments from my husband ("It looks great on you, and it's a real silky black"). I LOVE the built in sweater. The hood blocks a ton of wind and has adjustable cinchers, so it doesn't just fly right off your head on a windy day. All hardware and zippers are a stylish gold-tone. The interior pockets will work great for cell phone, passport, cash, whatever. The A-line style with the princess waist is flattering for every body type. It's surprisingly light for being down-filled. I ordered this coat to wear in Germany in January, and I have no doubts it will keep me warm!!

Buckle has a good weight to it, feels well-made and will keep your belt together solidly, holding up your knickers, skirt, or other garments ^_~ Stickers on the back (peeled off easily without leaving residue) read: 100% pewter and designed in the USA, made in Mexico. Imprinted on the inside back: #4486, (c)1997, Great American Products, solid fine pewter. Purchased 3 from Team Stores on Amazon's marketplace. Recommend this seller for great pricing and very fast shipping! Buckles are to be engraved and rosette on hat modified with a United States Coast Guard emblem for special presents this holiday season

Always an adventure ordering the mainland China/Korea menswear. Four times out of five, I like what I get. It's just not what I thought I was getting. I know this is going to go south (literally) after I wash it a few times, but in the meantime it looks good. If I were that kind of gal, I'd wear it with leggings & boots. But I'm not, but you could. Like most orders from this part of the world, it got to me in Pacific Northwest U.S. of A. in a little less than 2 weeks. Oh & my item is gray & darker gray, like I expected. None of the brownish/yellowish/bluish shades other reviewers mentioned.

reviewText:
So, this dress is actually quite pretty on.  I got it in coffee.  Only bad thing is that it's not lined, so if you're going to be outside in bright light, others will probably be able to see the outline of your legs.  Not an issue for me, but some may notice this.

Really, the big issue I had is that I ordered a small, and they sent me a medium. I contacted them, and their answer was that an Asian small equals a USA medium.  Well, I'm 5'1" 108lbs, and I expected a small dress. It was pretty obvious I was ordering a dress from China, and almost everyone is aware that the sizes are smaller.  They shouldn't just change the sizes without advertizing that.  I would not have ordered it if I had known that.

So I ended up with a dress that was too big (like 3 inches too big in the waist).  They offered me an $11 credit, not really super thrilled.  What I really want is my size small that I ordered. Anyway, I re-sewed the waist so it's smaller, and I wear it with a 2 inch off-white leather belt, so the top is a little more blouson-like.  Looks nice, I've gotten multiple compliments. Goes down to my mid-calf as in the pictures.
summary: Company resizes automatically, dress is pretty, but you won't get the size you order

I was completely  unsatisfied and disappointed and will not be purchasing from this seller again.

reviewText: Very Cheaply made

Let me start off by saying that although this dress was decent, I ended up returning it. When I first put it on it was clear that it's not exactly made from high quality, but that is to be expected considering the price. I bought it for a specific "dressy" occasion and was hoping I might be able to make it work with a nicer blazer thrown over it, but in the end it just wasn't a good enough material. In saying this, however, it is something I would have worn out with my friends to get dinner/drinks, or a night out with my boyfriend. The only issue is that it was too big for me all around. I am 5'5 about 130 lbs, generally in good shape and slightly bigger on top than bottom, and it was somewhat baggy on me. I tried other belts that I already own with this dress (cause the one it comes with is literally just a piece of rope-like material), and it still didn't fit me as I would have liked. Another thing to keep in mind is that the back part of the top half is see-through. And actually, the front sequence part is not made of a very thick material either, so in the sun it is sort of see through as well. Once again, this would be fine for a night out with friends if you put a cute crop top or bralette underneath, but not necessarily appropriate for work or a nice function. All in all, if I would have ordered a smaller size, I would have kept the dress for the price alone. If you are similar in size as me, I would definitely go with a small.
summary: but in the end it just wasn't a good enough material

All in all, even with NOTHING in the pockets AND with a garter belt, I would constantly have to adjust this in order to wear it throughout the day.
I still think it's a great concept that just hasn't hit its mark yet. It is a good looking garter and is made with quality materials (felt great with the exception of the velcro). I hope the company making these considers releasing one compatible with garter belts; I think it would resolve a lot of the product's downsides.
TL;DR: I do not recommend spending money on this

reviewText: great

I've had this wallet for about 2 weeks now and I love it! I spent months researching various wallets for my needs (yes, I know it was a little OCD) but the thing is that I couldn't find a wallet that was a good fit for me.
Things that I look for in a wallet:
1.) needs to carry a lot of cards,
2.) needs to be secure,
3.) needs to be relatively slim,
4.) prefer that it's not made of metal or hard material
5.) prefer that it's light
6.) prefer smaller form factor

Enter the Bellroy Very Small wallet: It's about the height and width of a credit card but I can put 12 cards in it and it's still only slightly more than half an inch thick. The half zipper means that my cards are secure but when it's time to pull one out that I have space to flip through them without having to take them all out. Plus it's at a good price. But it's not all function, the leather makes it look classic while the Owl gives it a unique detail (I really like that), and on the blue version the contrast of the interior leather color looks pretty nice as well. The zipper slides smoothly and the construction feels sturdy.
One little negative thing I have to mention though: the color of the fabric lining is not the same as in the pictures. I originally ordered the black one because I really liked that detail with the light blue stitching and the matching color in the pattern of the fabric lining, but when I got the wallet the interior was different shades of brown. When I emailed them to ask if it was a fluke, they told me that ALL the wallets in the "very small" line now have the same brown color lining because they discovered that the blue coloring ran and stained the contents of the wallets. I wound up returning it and getting the blue one instead because even though it has the same brown fabric lining, the leather portion of the lining is this nice parchment color- makes for a nice contrast. Anyway, so just be mindful that when you order this wallet the interior color will not look like the pics they have here or on their actual website. Normally I would have removed a star for this- but their customer service responded to my emails super quickly, their emails were personal (not scripted), and they were very proactive about offering me alternatives and solutions- so in this case the great customer service made up for the minor issue and they definitely earned that extra star.
summary: Form factor comparison and a little note at the end...

I have had a Bellroy Very Small Wallet made with caramel dyed leather for some time now, and really like carrying it -- it goes in my front pocket! The leather is supple, and the zipper keeps the contents secure, while still allowing quick and easy access to the contents. After using the Very Small Wallet from Bellroy, I doubt I will ever use a wallet without a zipper again.

The credit card I mainly use, and a public transit card go in the thinner pocket, and about a half dozen less frequently used cards go in the larger pocket. Cash folded in thirds goes in the middle open area.

I have carried a sim card for my iPhone in the provided pocket when traveling, but had a really hard time getting it back out with my fingers.

Note that the Bellroy Very Small Wallet may have been updated since I got mine?

reviewText:
After my old pair of chelsea ankle boots crapped out I was on the hunt for a new pair. I'd previously had the Anne Klein Bunty boots and found them great for everyday wear as they were super comfy and easy to walk in, but this time around I wanted to find something just as comfy but with a higher heel and taller on the ankle, and this boot looked perfect!

It came much faster than advertised which was awesome and it just looks great. I love the heel and the height, and it goes up higher along the ankle just the way I like it, perfect for tucking in skinny jeans or leggings. It's also very comfy and easy to walk in; I can wear these all day no problem. Rubber sole also provides great grip for slippery walking conditions.

All in all, a great find for chelsea ankle boots! I've had these for a few weeks now and I wear them at least a few times a week! Love them :)

reviewText:
I pierced my baby's ears at 2 months old with the plastic non-allergenic earrings. After 7 weeks, we lost one. I searched in stores and hated what I saw. I read so many reviews and decided to go with these after a picture I saw. They are so much cuter than the picture! They are a perfect size for little ears; the post too.

My daughter is 8 months old now and has been wearing them everyday since the day we got them. The only thing is, they are small screw on backs so it's hard for someone with big fingers. They went on the first try lucky for me. Make sure your baby is calm before you put them on.

These are really adorable! They look cute and sparkly on my two-year-old. I love the security of the screwbacks and the fact that they seal the ends of the earring posts. Also, the earrings are so dainty that my daughter hasn't tried pulling them off (which she constantly did with her older, bigger ones).
The only minor issue is that there's a gap between the screwbacks and her ears which allows the earrings to turn all the time. This doesn't cause her any discomfort, but I have to keep adjusting them because I want them to be the right side up.
Still highly recommend these, and would buy more from this brand.

**UPDATED**
Two years later, these are still perfect in my daughter's ears. Once we got them in, we've only removed them a few times to clean. No issues at all with these earrings! Love them and am irdering a 2nd pair for my 2nd baby!

These earrings are perfect! Exactly as described and fit my 15 month old without being too big or too small. I was worried the edges of the wings would catch on her clothes or blanket, but they are very smooth and because of the screw backs, the earrings lay really close to her ears. Peace of mind knowing they're not going to irritate her ears with the real gold, too. The only (tiny) problem I had is that because they are so small, and the backs are too, it took me several tries to get the backs on before I could actually screw them on.

Got them when she was two months and a year later a
She still wears them everyday. Everyone raves about how beautiful they are.
summary: These earrings are perfect for my daughter

I am very pleased with this sweater.  For me it will be a multi-seasonal sweater that I will keep handy all the time.  I like a cardigan that fits loose enough that I can wear it over a t-shirt comfortably.  Once again, I was very pleased.

The sweater appeared to be well sewn and felt really good but the size was HUGE! I could have put almost 2 of me in it. I had to send it back and didn't order another one because I didn't know which size to order.

I love this sweater EXCEPT for the sleeves being to short.  Too short to call it long sleeve, but too long to call it 3/4 sleeve.  I've washed it a few times already and it didn't fade, the fabric is very comfortable, but the length of the sleeves really bothers me so I won't be buying another one.  Oh well.

This is exactly what I had hoped for.  I needed an indoor "Mr. Rodgers" sweater for comfort.  I am not a fan of layered clothing so I'm very pleased that this is a light knit, not heavy or restrictive.  I'm a tall woman so I did up size my order to accommodate shoulders and sleeve length.  Shoulders are perfect, even with a fleece shirt underneath.  The sleeves are quite long however, even for my lengthy reach.  If you are a regular height person you may have to fold the sleeves but remember I went one size up.

Okay, lets talk washing.  This is a light knit, loose sweater.  This is a guess at this point (I'll update when I wash, but may be awhile) but I'd recommend cold water, low cycle and a wash bag.  I don't think this sweater could survive one normal spin cycle particularly with an older tub model that has the plastic paddles strings could attach too.  This would definitely be a lay flat to dry sweater, maintaining shape will be an issue.

I do love it, it's brutally cold outside at this exact moment and it has spanked the urge to inch that thermostat up a tick.
The sweater arrived looking like an elephant had worn it.  The sleeves were sooo long, the front panels sagged low and the back was hiked up. Never again.

Pros: Very slim, offset between slots for cards helps keep bulk down. Fits well in both rear and side pockets of both jeans and dress pants. Awesome partition in money pocket to separate receipts or store different currencies.

Cons: Cards slide out WAY too easily. In the few weeks I've had this wallet, I've had credit cards slip out and fall onto the floor multiple times while making purchases. With enough effort it's possible to get the cards seated in their pocket a bit better but by the next time you open the wallet they have slid back up and are prime to fall out. While I've seen that others don't necessarily have these problems, it's enough of a problem for me that I'm planning to switch back to my old wallet or find another.
summary: Designed with good intentions, but not great at holding in cards!

reviewText:
I like the long wrists and the snug knit, but I am not convinced they are anything other than acrylic.
They are not particularly warm, and lack the legal import fabric content tag required by the FTC.
I did the natural fiber content burn test on part of a seam -- real animal fiber will smell like burning hair and turn to powder ash.
Synthetics will melt and smell chemical. This melted.
At most, they are a very very very low percentage of alpaca blended with acrylic to justify calling it alpaca.
Don't expect too much.
summary: Caveat emptor: probably just acrylic, not alpaca. I like the long wrists and the snug knit.
