Received on time. They are warm and soft!

I will be the first to admit it--I have tactile issues.

There, I said it.

So, when I read about these darling non-gloves that were "so soft," I thanked my lucky stars and ordered immediately!!

Call me starry (or wooly, as it were) - eyed. It's true. The softness was too good to be true unfortunately.

Now, you'll do well to note that softness is of course a relative description; these babies are soft for being wool. But would I pick them up in a store and call them soft? Absolutely not.

HOWEVER, they do have a few other things going for them:

1. TINY!!! And they have a very nice stretch to them.

2. SUPER lightweight

3. WARM!!!

Several years ago I bought Outdoor Research flip-top mittens. I plan to layer these wool fingerless gloves under those (which are soft but not warm for a Chicago winter).

And in addition to deducting a star for the softness deception, I also deducted one for not being a fair trade product. These are beautifully made--in Peru....in a sweatshop?? I shudder to think about it, and not just because it's cold!

reviewText:
I order from Amazon often. I was extremely upset about this order.
Shipping:
 Order arrived later than I was told.  No option for any other shipping method, only USPS...
Product quality:
Materials are good but craftsmanship was poor. The inlayed crystal was drilled into the wrong spot of the pendant, covering the words and leaving a black "spot" where it should have been placed. How about a bit of QA people?
The chain is pretty but it doesn't fit the diameter of the eyelet on pendant. Trying to remove the flimsey catch for the clasp so I could put it on the chain resulted in it breaking.
It was a gift for a grieving friend. I ended up going to a silver store with tears in my eyes to buy a different one before the funeral. The kind lady at my local store said the quality was that of "Claire's" (cheap) and put a better quality clasp on it for free. So I have it for myself right now and spent 30 dollars on a similar hematite pendant with jeweler details for my friend.
Even more surprizing is that KONOV has yet to respond to my concerns, and this lady fixed the necklace for me as best she could for free when she didn't sell it to me.
Amazon's customer service people were very helpful but say I won't get a refund from the seller since it was repaired. Guess I'll wait and see but it's been a week and a half.
Thank you for nothing KONOV, you guys are a joke.
summary: hate to be the bad guy...

This is the perfect ring for someone who doesn't have a lot of money to buy an expensive wedding set!! This set is beautiful!! I have had this set for 3 months now and it's still as beautiful as it was when I got it and I wear it all the time!! I'm in the health field and I wash my hands all the time and nothing has happened to this ring!! For anyone who has problems with cheap jewelry turning their fingers green.... This set will NOT do that!! This is a GREAT BUY!!! <3

I purchased this ring over a year ago and I purpously waited to write my review.  I waited to see if the ring's quality would fail.  I am pleased to say that the quality of this ring is superb, and looks as good, if not better than my gold rings.  They remain beautiful and true to size, even after a year.  Overall, I am very pleased to have purchased this set, which has the quality of gold and diamonds for a FRACTION of the price!

My fiance and I have been wedding ring shopping for a few weeks. We've been going to jewelers and shopping online, while trying to find the best pricing for the type of ring I was wanting. I've always been very weary with buying items online, but I decided, that if I found THE ring online, than to just go for it! Sooo when I came across this ring, I absolutely loved it! I added it to my wishlist amongst some other rings. I kept coming back to this ring and you know that when you do that, the item is saying something to you - so I made the big decision and we bought it! I am a girl who LOVES the sparkle, the glitter, with everything that shines and it looked like this ring was showing just that! The price was jaw dropping. When we received it in the mail (shipping took as long as it said it would) I told my fiance that I was closing my eyes and for him to open the nice box outside, so I could see this ring show off its sparkle in the sunshine! When I saw the ring, I literally jumped with joy and squealed! The sterling silver is pure and shiny, it fits true to size, and wow ... the ring is gorgeous! I am so happy and very much so in love with it. I honestly think I have the most gorgeous ring out of any girl I know! Thank you!!

This shirt is great. Distressed Mickey logo is basically the only shirt I could get my husband to wear for our upcoming Disney trip. My only complaint....and funny his too...is that it's really dark gray. I would say charcoal gray. It's actually very hard to see the Mickey. Nice shirt overall and accurate sizing. Just wish we saw Mickey a little better.

A junior's medium or adult small would normally have been fine. The is sized more for a medium child. But, after some thought and a nice letter from the Geek Tees, I think I will keep it for another child. Geek Tees is very nice to work with.

This watch looks great, but the quality of the movement is suspect.  My watch was shipped from China in a rather flat, KS branded cardboard box that was badly dented in transit.  Inside the box the watch was nicely packed, and included tags, warranty, instructions, etc.

The KS-095 has a more elegant design than similar Chinese multi-function watches.  The main hands and lower dial (24 hour), are set by the crown.  The day and date dials are set with the recessed pushers on either side of the crown.  The instructions specify the main watch hands be set to 5:30 before using the pushers to not damage the movement.  The case is a reasonable 40mm in diameter, but at 15mm thick, feels a bit clunky. The face looks a bit plastic on very close inspection.  All six hands are inset with a poor quality lume that fades in minutes.  There is no lume other than the hands. The writing and logo on the dial are very sharp, but some of the gold hour indices are slightly skewed off-angle.

The band is made of stiff leather, that is sized for Asian wrists.  I have smaller wrists, but I still need to use the third hole from the end.  It is rather thick, but seems to be conforming and getting more comfortable with age. The band seems sturdy, but only time will tell.  The buckle is low grade (stainless?) steel, and does not match the case's gold finish.  It also must have a low chrome content, and seems to tarnish. The exhibition back reveals a nice looking "turned" Kronen & Shne branded counter weight sticker, giving the appearance of an engraved part.  The rest of the KM0206 movement has rather crudely finished metal parts.

My initial complaint was that the movement sometimes stopped while being worn, and had a poor power reserve.  This watch often stopped running when placed on the night stand while I was sleeping.  The reserve seemed to run 6-12 hours.  I have discovered that while the KM0206 movement is non-hacking, it does allow hand-winding.  Since fully hand-winding the watch, it seems to be working fine (maximum 30hr reserve). Unlike previous automatics I've owned, the self-winding doesn't seem sufficient to keep this model working.

Overall, this is a nice looking watch from a foot away.  It doesn't really look or feel cheap, but its "automatic" movement reflects the price paid.

Update:  The gold plated finish is wearing off in places after less than 1 year of use,  The crown's finish went first, and now the lower case finish is wearing away/tarnishing.  I have managed to clean up both with a Q-tip and some Bar Keeper's Friend cleaner, but the etched KS logo on the crown is now gone and the case is a bit rough where it lost plating.  This is ultimately a disposable watch, and is priced accordingly.  I would suggest choosing the stainless steel option for a longer lasting finish.  I just really liked the look of the watch in gold.
summary: Cheap Inside, Where It Counts - Requires Hand-Winding

reviewText:
I would recommend this watch to a friend.

Bold dial and black color looks cool. There is a window on the back where you can see the ticking wheel and gizmos. Hard to believe you can get an automatic self winding watch for this cheap. Slide rule is cool. This watch does in fact tell time. Good for a first automatic watch.

The instant you feel this watch you can tell it is cheap and fragile. I was afraid I would break it because the scratch-protection plastic was very difficult to remove and the wristband feels flimsy. The date and day setting buttons don't work, but setting the time works. The second hand keeps ticking even while setting the time, so it can't be synchronized down to the second. The slide rule is slightly inaccurate (e.g. it said 2.00 * 2.00 = 3.90).

Obviously you get what you pay for. The telling time part of this watch works, it looks cool, and it is good value. The complications do not work.

Update: The complications do work. I think it only doesn't work between 9pm-3am, perhaps because the date mechanism is in action during that time window.
Beautiful watch with great functionality. However, it's a tad fast.

They make me sure-footed as a mountain goat and graceful as a gazelle (wearing too-tall hooves).  They usually last about a year on shoes that I rotate around regularly, so maybe 30-40 wearings?  After that they'll start to migrate around and need to be replaced.  I've used these for years, and so does my teen daughter.  I think they're a great value, they improve safety, and they can take a pair of shoes that feel a little 'iffy' and turn them into something you can walk well in. I'm a regular bow tie wearer. I recently bought this, as well as two other ties, to try to I prove my daily rotation. At first, I was impressed by the PenSee tie. I like the gold (some gold bow ties look too glossy and are better suited for tuxedos rather than more casual wear). The fabric felt nice and the tie tied very easily (some ties are too stiff and more difficult to manage).

Three weeks in, wearing this tie about twice per week, it has begun to fray around the edges. At first I thought it was just my tie breaking in a bit. But it is getting worse. Soon, the tie will be completely unwearable.

Yeah, it's a bargain tie. But so were the other two I bought (and every other tie in my collection). I've never paid more than $15 for a bow tie and most of mine cost under $10. I've worn a handful of them regularly for years without a sign of wear. For this one to fall apart after a few weeks is ridiculous.

If you're looking for a novelty that you're only going to use once or twice, this tie will do fine. But if you want it for regular wear (or as a gift to regular tie wearers) I would steer clear and save your money. There are plenty of similarly priced ties that are just as inexpensive without being so cheaply made.
summary: Tips from a bow tie regular

BTW - it looks like the prices are going on on similar PenSee bowties from $4.99+ship to $7.99+ship. Get the ones you want now soon, assuming they're up'ing the price on all bowties in the near future :P

reviewText: I've bought dresses from this same manufacturer before and they fit perfectly.  NOT THIS TIME!!!  I was on a strict time limit and ordered four different dressed from Amazon in the same size I've always gotten, a six.  Every single one of them was WAY too small.  My 12 year old daughter, who weighs 108 lbs and is 5'3" barely fit into any of them.  I'm 5'9" and weigh around 160.  You can imagine they did NOT fit me.  I'm very thin "on top" with a curvy "hour glass body shape", my waist is only 27' around, so this dress SHOULD HAVE FIT ME.  I've had to send them all back and try again.  Hopefully, I'll get something by tomorrow, as my event is the day after tomorrow.  Very disappointing.  This was the most appropriate dress for my function, so I've reordered this one in a size 10 (I'm NOT a size 10. . . .I've been wearing size 4 dresses for a long time, especially in this "shape" of dress.)  I'll let you know if THAT one fits when I get it. . . .fingers crossed!!!

They even will throw you $20 for return shipping! Great I thought, until I went to post office and discovered they would be $60 to send back! (From the east coast, I can only guess it will be more from the west coast)

So, long story short, they are great boots, but order a size down...or you'll be selling them on bookoo/Craig's list like I did :/

Has been the best key chain ever!

This seat-belt keychain is the best I have owned so far. Sturdy design - the seat-belt feels quite solid and secure, one handed operation is very convenient.
To me, one of the best things about this is it's ability to be moved around my belt to different positions that jingle-and-jangle the least, as opposed to a keychain that can only be  placed where you hook it, and if you have heavy keys can damage your pants or make them droop (more) awkwardly.

The only "Con" that I can think of is that you have to be careful when you remove your keys; mine tend to drop to the ground if I don't hold on to them firmly. But I have yet to have an accidental unbuckling of my keys.

This was purchased for my wife. She loves it and has not lost her keys ONCE since we got it for her. The double snap on the loop gives a double secure hold so that even the heaviest of keys (she also has a monkey fist on her keychain) don't break loose and get lost! The simple design is easy to use one handed. The materials and construction are quality and durable.

**This product was a personal purchase for myself at the normal retail price. I am reviewing it solely because I want to share my experience with other potential customers. I have received no compensation for my review nor do I have any relationship with the seller or manufacturer of this product.

I LOVE this thing. It's so simple yet efficient for a person who constantly breaks lanyards and carabiners. Just loop this around your belt (or your pants loop but it doesn't look as nice) and you're ready to go. I took off the keychain rings and put only 1 in the center for symmetry. A lot of the time people recognize the symbol right away.

Great construction. I've dropped this numerous times and the clasp still holds sturdy just like the day I bought it. Quick release and simple design. Definitely worth the money. Definitely check this out if you are in the market for a different way to hold your keys.

PS: If this came in an all black finish where the belt loop buttons are I would buy that in a heartbeat!

I wear size 10 normally and ordered 8/10usa. When I got the skirt out of the package it looked alarmingly small but I was surprised how stretchy the band was, how nicely the skirt sat in all the right places, and how the nice wide band prevented from creating side/belly rolls. The peplum portion is wide enough to conceal midsection imperfections.
Length somewhat short but I'd have no problem wearing it to the office, opaque tights maybe. The peplum looked likely was hemmed in a hurry because one small area had wrinkled stitching going on but that went away after a wash. This skirt gives a nice support actually, I think I'll look if this seller has other colors.

I bought this dress for my daughter's and they fell in love from the second we pulled it out of the package! Having three teenagers in the house, we are constantly in need of semi-formal dresses for school as well as for the cruises we take. I'm always looking for good deals for them. I found this dress on Amazon and decided to order it for them. I wasn't sure how the fit would be, because it seems like a lot of the clothing items we order, end up coming from China and are extremely small compared to US sizes. This dress was perfect! It was the exact size we needed. I thought it was very well made and my daughters said the material was really comfy. There also is a stretchy element to the dress, so it hugs to the skin and stretches. It is not low cut, and fits very well. I do highly reccomend this dress for anyone looking for semi-formal attire. I do think the pictures don't do it justice and it looks great on! The rhinestones on the belt area are a great accent and really sets off the shimmery material on the dress. I reccomend this dress!

The Aries stone (diamond) is plain crystal and it does look brilliant. The earring is well constructed especially the stem and backs (locks) that do not irritate skin even with extended wearing.

These are great during lightning deals - 10 bucks but not worth the full retail of 50. There are better alternatives out there.

Pros:
* Brilliant in shine
* Well constructed
* Stem and back are high quality and do not irritate ear lobes

Cons:
* Appear smaller than advertised
* Pricey
summary: Nice, But Expect Smaller Than You Imagine. Pricey at Full Retail.

reviewText:
I have purchased these in the same size for years.  Suddenly the sizing is different.  I've purchased two packages in my usual size, and all the panties were at least a size, maybe two sizes smaller than before.  I know it's not me (!!) that's changed, as my older pairs of the same product still fit well.  Also, the older ones are softer and more comfortable.  This new fabric is kind of stiff and scratchy, and feels and looks cheap.
I'm stuck with these things.  Since I knew this product so well I immediately discarded the packaging and receipts.  I've learned my lesson.  Now I'm looking for another brand.  I'm done with Hanes.

I've been buying Hanes for at least 20 years, and love the Hi-Cut panties. I purchased both the 6-pack assorted and the 3 pack white and while the tidy-whities in the 3-pack were fine, the assorted were, well, assorted when it came to quality and fit. As others have noted, they were a thinner fabric than usual and the sizes were different when matched together. Interestingly, the Hipsters were fine and so, even though I don't like them as well, I may start wearing them instead, just for quality control.
These are too small, stiff, and scratchy.  I lasted an hour before I had to change, then they all went into the trash. Please Hanes, bring back the comfortsoft hi-cut panties!
summary: The entire package went in the trash

reviewText: so cute

I am 5'8" 150 lbs athletic build.  I ordered a Medium and it fit perfectly.  The arms were perfect length for my long arms and the floor length was perfect with flats.  The material, although thinner than some other jersey material dresses I own, was not see through in the least, and not overly warm, which was perfect for the choral concert I wore the dress for.  It has slight gathering of material at the waist line on the left side along with the tied belt of the same material as the dress.  The V neck is actually more like a wrap dress, although all attached.  Could easily accommodate smaller or larger chests.  I'm on the small side and it covered everything modestly.  The dress was lovely, but I wish it was a little cheaper, since it was fairly simple and lacking in fancy embellishments that would warrant a higher cost.

The biggest issue is that upon opening the package I was overwhelmed with the smell of mildew. There is no discoloration, but the hat reeks. It is currently in the washing machine (in a delicates bag), as a hand washing was not sufficient to remove the smell. The seems inside the hat are cheap and I'm worried it might come apart. I will update this review if it does.

If you have mold allergies, AVOID THIS SELLER. They obviously have no moisture controls in their warehouse. Also, the packaging was quite cheap and had holes ripped in it. The hat was not even in a clear plastic bag within the outer plastic mailing pocket. Perhaps this is how it became mildewy, as they don't store the hats in individual bags...

reviewText:
I love this necklace. I originally thought I'd use it for Fall but it's cute and light enough to wear now in summer. I like the multiple strands of hearts that hang down very nicely. There are multiple strands so you have to kind of sort them a bit if you don't store it hanging but it's worth it. It dresses up any outfit and in summer goes perfect with any sort of neckline or top and has that "bohemian" feel to it and when it's on you can pair it with some bangles and your jewelry accessorizing is complete.
I was given a discount on this item to review it but believe me I tell the truth about the items I review and I really like this one and recommend it.

Here's the thing, I absolutely LOVE this necklace--I wore it yesterday and it was beautiful and my friend made a comment about how pretty it is. Plus, it has an actual locket so I'm going to get a small picture for it. The only criticisms I have are that the clasp that hooks is a weaker metal, and I can already see it pulling open which will break it. I think I have a pair of pliers around here some where and I'm going to squeeze that ring/circle closed so it's not pulling open. The other thing is that the necklace is a MESS to deal with--I almost think it should have been designed so all the necklaces hook off of one main chain, rather than having a bunch of necklaces lumped together to clasp. Trying to organize and unravel this to put it on takes time, all the chains get tangled and folded over each other and it's a huge mess.  If you have the patience to work it out and organize it so you can put it on--the necklace itself is stunning. Each charm is beautiful and well made. It's a nice thick metal and most of the chain is thick and durable--only the ones that attach to the clasp are questionable as I mentioned earlier.
This is a gorgeous necklace. Keep it hung up so it stays untangled and you will have a beautiful necklace that will get tons of compliments. Disclaimer: I have received a discounted rate in exchange for providing my honest review but my opinion is solely my own. All thoughts above reflect my honest and unbiased opinion. If I find any feature of this product less than satisfactory, I will not withhold it in my review. I just want to say this upfront because as a buyer, whenever I see this disclaimer at the end of a review, I tend to dismiss it and assume that the review is biased. I am not affiliated with this company or any of their products, in any way. Rest assured that my reviews honestly address my experience with a product, whether good or bad. Receiving this product at a discounted price has not affected my opinion or review of this product. I have not been coached or asked to provide positive feedback, nor have I received any compensation or incentive from the company for this review. I am disclosing this in accordance with the Federal Trade Commission 16 CFR part 255 "guides concerning the use of endorsements and testimonials in advertising.

I suggest  to anyone wanting opera glasses to order from another source.  Very poor customer service, as I will describe.
I ordered the Ultra compact  HQRP opera glasses because of the lens strength of 7 x 25.  They were shipped in a timely fashion, however, upon examination of the package content, I found that the package was torn, the glasses were packed inside the vinyl pouch without instructions nor the described cleaning cloth. There was no way to ascertain whether the glasses were truly 7 x 25 because there were no markings or anything inside the package or tag attached that showed the lens strength. I assumed, because of everything I have described, that maybe the item had been previously sold and returned.  Initially, I contacted the seller directly  hoping to speak to someone about resolution, hoping I could get an exchange.  I chatted with someone that gave me a telephone number and an e-mail address.  No one answered the phone when I called.  I then sought resolution by contacting the seller through Amazon.  After sending pictures of the glasses, contents and the box, I WAS FNALLY TOLD ; " We are sorry for the inconvenience caused, but we sell only new items and we believe the package was damaged during transportation. Anyway we can confirm that you received binocular exactly as ordered and advertised."  I assume I am suppose to accept that statement at face value. THEY NEVER PRESENTED THE EVIDENCE.  Bottom line-- They did nothing about it. Is the 200 day warranty void also??

I got the XXL, thinking it would fit comfortably since it's made in China.  Well, it does fit, very comfortably, except for one thing...the hip area is sewn for some pretty weird looking hips.  Or maybe if I had a huge butt/hips, the material would stretch and it wouldn't look weird.  You know when you put a wet shirt on a hanger and take it off after it dries and there are these two belled out parts on the sleeve where the hanger was?  That's what's on the dress where the hips are, but it's sewn this way.  I'm keeping it because I'm positive I can alter it and get rid of those - it's like 4 inches of sewing on each side.  I'm 5'6" 130lbs and wear a size 6-8 in US clothing.  All other aspects of this dress fit me very nicely.  The arms are close to being tight, but aren't.  If I gain any weight in my arms they'll be snug, but right now it fits great.  Now I just need to alter those bells at the hips. I got the mostly black dress with white on the sides.  I really like it and I cannot even believe how fast it got here!  Like 3 days at the most.

I purchased a wallet of this same design five years ago, and it worked so well that I've been searching for another.  When I found this Mundi I was thrilled.  It fits nicely in my purse, holds all my many cards, plus even space for coupons without stuff sticking out!
I still love the design, but this wallet has not held up well.  The leather is peeling along all the exposed edges, and it looks a lot older than 1 year.  I guess for the price, even for a year it's worth it.

I picked mine up at JCPenny - and it's not this color, it's a water color print, but the structure and function is the same.  MSRP is $40, I spent $26, and this seems like a great deal, I really like this neutral color, and may have picked this if I'd seen it first!  I am doing the Dave Ramsey's cash only method.  This wallet already has little file categories with tags printed on them, but I use small envelopes and put them right in the file compartments: receipts in one, envelopes in the other two, I can get about 8 envelopes in there with no problem shutting the wallet.  It's actually quite slim  - I don't have a checkbook or register in it though.  If there are cash envelopes I don't need to carry around with me, I just remove them and keep them at home, which is great, because I don't want to carry ALL my money with me. I did a lot of looking for cash system wallets, and there are some great ones, I just wanted to be able to remove my envelopes.  Another thing that this wallet has is credit card slots that empty toward the spine of the wallet, not OUT.  They have others that do empty out, where I keep frequent shopper cards, and other non important things.  Another great feature it has is "safekeeper" which is some kind of lining that prevents thieves from using scanners and getting your credit card numbers.  All in all, I am very pleased with my new wallet - it seems sturdy, but I haven't had it long, so I hope it holds up.

My fiance bought this ring for me 8 months ago, and I love it.  I get tons of compliments on how cute and dainty the band is, and how clear the stone looks.  The stone itself is really sparkly when in direct sunlight, and under florescent lighting.  Under regular lighting it just looks like a diamond.  I don't see any warmth in the stone, but occasionally when its cloudy it looks SLIGHTLY gray to me.  I doubt anybody else would ever notice since they aren't staring at it all day every day like I am.  When we went to jewelry stores to look for wedding bands the sales staff all referred to my ring as having a diamond, and even went to clean it without noticing it was a moissanite.  One thing to keep in mind is that the 4 prong setting makes some people think it is a cushion cut or princess cut stone, so if you really want the round look you should find a 6 prong setting.  All in all I think my ring is perfect.  Classic and beautiful.

Love this coat. Once I figured out what size I was, it fits great. Got so many compliments for the style.

FOR SIZE - if you like slim fit then order one size above what you usually get. If you like it more relaxed style or like to layer, get at least two sizes above what you usually get.

Funny thing is, if you remove the fur lining then the size is exactly as you would expect. I first ordered a medium (which I usually wear in USA) and it was too small with the fur attached. Without the fur in it fits perfect. I reordered one size larger and it fits perfect with the fur.

The fur is fake but feels really good. It may not brave the most severe winter storms but for a cold day it works great.

It's a really slick jacket. BUT PAY ATTENTION TO THE SIZE CONVERSION. The measurements they have posted are accurate, even if the size names (S, M, L, etc.) are a bit different. Go by your measurement, not your normal size. The fake fur isn't nasty and synthetic feeling, like most fake furs. It's pleasant. The outer material is also not what you'd expect from the picture, and feels very high quality.

Not only is the product great, but Hee Grand's Amazon department is really helpful too. They'll probably email you to confirm your size, help you get correct measurements, etc. If you're on the fence: just buy it, bro. Very worth it.
summary: The Picture Doesn't Do It Justice

reviewText:
The picture made it seem like it would be a much more slimming fit, so I was initially disappointed with it. But some time walking around with this jacket really made me enjoy it. It's so warm, which works for me since I don't always want to layer up (I can leave it unzipped and unbuttoned with just a T-Shirt in 20 degree weather). The fabric also has a fantastic, high-quality feel to it. The fur lining manages to be subtle enough to be understated, but impressive enough to be eye-catching; I've gotten many compliments because of it.

The sizing wasn't a major problem at all. I wear a medium, so I got a large. I kept it simple and just measured my arm length and compared it to the arm length of the description. If you're still uncertain, email them and they'll give you the proper sizing measurements and can recommend the proper fit. It really only takes at most 10 minutes of preparation and you can avoid major disappointment.
Craftsmanship poor.  Pockets tore after wearing only a few days

I needed a new pair of winter boots, and I was looking specifically for booties that had a strong lace, decent padding, and a really good rubber tread - because (yes, I'm somewhat crazy) I'll be wearing these in snow.  I really don't have a bad thing to say about them - they met all my criteria, they're comfortable and they're well made. Great boots!
Love them wear then every day.

These boots are very cute and comfortable, the material is not bad, heels are bearable, adjust the ankle normally, are of large size, so if you're 8 Order it 7/5, delivery was very fast, I recommend it .
What can I say?  I'm a guy that absolutely LOVES seeing a woman look her sexiest best as often as possible and this certainly pushes things in that direction nicely!

They look great but the back and the sides of the boot don't fit as I would expect it to against my ankle and the sides but for the cost it's not so bad. They are really cute and after placing some cushy foot pads in them, I could wear them for a few hours and they didn't bother me.  I changed the laces to solid black and they looked dressier.  They make your feet look smaller because of the cute round front and I love the ridged bottom.

They definitely run a half-size large. The faux suede is VERY faux. It looks okay from a distance and LOOKS suede-esque, but to the touch it's coarse and unpleasant, not at all like suede. They seem sturdy enough, they are level so I don't feel my ankles trying to buckle when I walk in them. Taller than expected. Description states '4.5" from arch' so actually 5" maybe a little more.

Over-all pleased for the price.
This boot is very cute but it runs large.  I usually wear a 6-1/2; this is like a size 7 and the heel is a little higher than I expected.  But I like it.

Bought these for my little 4 year old. He loves Mater and he loves the slippers. He does slip a little but he likes sliding across the floor. If you don't have mats on your stairs though you might have an accident. These hold up really well too. They don't have holes or anything (look almost brand new) and he's worn them every day for a couple months.
Great product for the price.

reviewText: These slippers are fantastic! They are very comfortable, fit well, and are very warm! My feet sweat in them sometimes, so they aren't the most breathable, but hey, they're slippers.

I suffer from poor circulation and my feet are always cold.  I wear a size 12 and these slippers in the X-large are supposed to fit size 13-14.  I ordered this size so I could wear a pair of heavy socks with them.  Much to my disappointment I could not begin to get my feet into them with socks on.  I was barely able to squeeze into them with my bare feet.  They are very tight.  To add insult to injury the day after I received my order I found the exact same slippers at Walmart for $4.50 less.  I learned my lesson.
